website_summaries.verdict: An entry-level crossbow with lots of extras and sporty styling. A good product, though it's probably not the first choice of a serious outdoorsman.
pros: Stock has an AR style that offers a tactical feel
In addition to the crossbow, you receive a scope, rope cocker, bolts, and quiver
cons: Not quite as durable as other models, but worth considering for novices

customer_reviews.title: Little Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Just received my Crosman Sniper 370 crossbow. I'm a little disappointed. The package I received includes a non-illuminated scope. The scope pictured on my Amazon order, in the crossbow assemble instructions, and any where else the scope is pictured/visible is the illuminated scope. My local Academy Sports and Cabela's sell at the same price point but with the Illuminated scope which from my experience is much better in dim light. Like I said: a little disappointed that I did not get what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: I liked it at first once all together
customer_reviews.text: This crossbow broke after the second time shooting it. It was dangerous how metal parts went flying by my face. I liked it at first once all together, but very dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Adams

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Crossbow
customer_reviews.text: I don’t get paid to review anything and I will not review anything till I’ve used it many times. This is my second deer season using this crossbow. I have taken five deer with this crossbow...Two bucks and three does. In all five shots, the bolt has completely went the deer The longest shot was 46 yards on a very nice ten point. I did replace the scope that came with it but this crossbow shoots very consistently and with a good bolt and broadhead....You will have no problem taking any game animal. This is a quality product that I will highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Robert R.

customer_reviews.title: Easy Peasy
customer_reviews.text: This is the first CrossBow I have owned. It arrived quickly and was super easy to assemble. I was concerned with the reviews that talked about how difficult the instructions were to follow. Maybe they revised them over time, but the assembly took 15 minutes max. I took it out and shot it at 20 yds. Bolts were hitting low and right. I adjusted the scope 60 clicks up and 60 clicks left and BINGO, I was dead on (with field points). This CrossBow seems to pack a lot of power and buries the bolt deep into the target. I will have it out hunting early next week. Great purchase!!!
customer_reviews.author: John Petrie

customer_reviews.title: Bow is good but scope arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: Crossbow is actually quite good and works fine but the scope arrived broken and unusable. After firing the bow for the first time, the scope would not focus and you could hear parts jingling around inside. I called crossman and they offered to replace the scope but only if I paid for shipping it to them, which they would not reimburse. I ended up buying a different scope at a sporting goods store for around $50 which works perfectly. With this added expense and inconvenience, and the difficulty with crossman support, I deducted 2 stars from what would otherwise be a 4-star product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really like this Xbow!
customer_reviews.text: For the money you can't beat this crossbow. It was a breeze to put it together. It took 6 shots to zero the scope at 20 yards and was dead on at 30 yards. It launches 430 grain bolts down range at 360 fps. I am amazed that this Xbow was so inexpensive. I will be getting the new Centerpoint Power Craw cranking device because I'm 68 yoa and cocking the bow gets to be a pain for me after 12 cycles. I'll be shouting to the winds about my new bow.
customer_reviews.author: Joe M.

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first bow purchase so I'm not too experienced in how one should be made. My father in law is a long time bow hunter. He likes Horton and ten point (of course he does). He looked it up and down and held it but we have yet to sight it in and target practice with it, but from what he sayd it is a decent bow that should get me by till I'm more experienced in bow hunting to go out and spend 700+ on one. Will update with the new season. Hopefully we can hunt with this covid-19 mess.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie money

customer_reviews.title: Works well at a very good price
customer_reviews.text: This was my first crossbow and it seemed very well thought out. The directions were fair and took a little trial and error but I got together in about 40 minutes. I got familiar with it via lengthy sighting in and target practice with field points and then broadheads. It seemed very accurate and consistent. Definitely you need a target block designed for a crossbow. For a newby this is really a relatively inexpensive way to start and I doubt I’ll need something more elaborate. The scope is just ok and I might spring for an upgrade. I took a star off because the lens caps for the scope were supposed to be included but were not in the box.
customer_reviews.author: PeteF

customer_reviews.title: Be prepared might be used.
customer_reviews.text: Ok so my issue is the fact that everything looks like its used. And I'm missing the shoulder strap with that said. Not a huge ordeal I didn't buy it for the strap I can make one. But I buy used item and I get what I expect sometimes more. But I REALLY HATE IT when I fork out and buy full price to get something new and I get a used item with missing items really pisses in my cheerios.
customer_reviews.author: robert boyd

customer_reviews.title: Nice entry level kit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kit to get into bow hunting/shooting again after 15 years away from hobby. My eyesight isn’t the best anymore and the scope helps quite a bit. Nice to target shoot and practice with. Very rifle like to shoot, accurate out to about 60 yards, for me 50 is better group. Glad I bought it, very adequate entry kit. Scope is competent, trigger is ok/tolerable, crossbow is dead on. Nice loud thump when targets hit, plenty of penetration out to 50-60 yards. I’m not a high end competitive shooter so for me it’s perfect, we’ll over 1000 bolts/shoots fired. I wax string and oil crossbow fairly religiously.
customer_reviews.author: Corporate Slave

customer_reviews.title: Missing Parts: Shoulder Sling & Stud
customer_reviews.text: Product Information lists that a Shoulder Sling is included with this item but a sling was not in my package. The Parts List also lists a Shoulder Sling as well as a Shoulder Sling Stud which also was not not in my package. Will Amazon remedy this issue?
customer_reviews.author: Kayvano

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply built
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. Pay attention to any reviews that mention defective parts and breakable components. My horizontal adjustment knob for the scope had a cap that was screwed on very tight, I tried unscrewing it and the entire knob fell off. My horizontal accuracy is very low now.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate and strong; easy to use too.
customer_reviews.text: My 1st crossbow ever. So easy to use. I get consistent groupings (1" from 20 yards; 3" from 30 yards; 5" from 40 yards; 8" from 50 yards. My 8-yr old son hits 8" plate at 60 yards; it's that good. After just a month, I already tagged a couple deer with it at 40 yards; arrows passed completely through deer and produced easy blood trails.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: He loves it
customer_reviews.text: Gift for my oldest son who is hunter and has a compound bow. He had mentioned that he was wanting to get crossbow. Did alot of research and found this one to be highly recommended, so I ordered this one for him. I did get better quality arrows and bows due to during research it was mentioned multiple times that the ones that came with it broke and split easily and not very durable. But the crossbow itself is made of quality for price and he loves it
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: This thing nasty
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this thing and let's just say it is nasty.. fast man it's fast. At 50yrds field point I'm shooting the size of a dime grouping off a table.. took the scope it came with off and put a new brand on.. but for the money, the accuracy and speed I can't complain
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Wow, top end at low end price
customer_reviews.text: I think someone priced this wrong This is a high end bow by any standard Nothing cheap here You will not be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Riser screw does not thread into the rail
customer_reviews.text: The main riser screw does not thread into the rail / body of the crossbow. This large screw holds the “bow” portion onto the rail, so I cannot even begin to assemble the crossbow. Nothing is stripped. The threads simply do not match at all. The riser screw will not even go in one turn without meeting resistance. What a piece of junk and waste of my time. And yes I have tried with and without having the bow on the rail at the time of assembly to isolate the problem. Either the screw or rail has the wrong threads.
customer_reviews.author: ErinTx

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Accurate
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together, just remember Loc-tite during assembly. Things will vibrate loose eventually if you don’t. This crossbow is accurate! Added a better scope and shoot easy 3” groups at 50 yards. 1” groups at 30 yards, as I have messed up some fletchings when shooting multiple bolts. Included scope can be used, just does not have ranges close to the speed of this crossbow. Only con for this crossbow is the adjustable stock makes noise and requires some silencing tape. Throw away the included bolts and get some heavier bolts as noted in other reviews. Happy with the purchase considering the price point and accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: Zach A.

customer_reviews.title: accurate but the worst trigger ever
customer_reviews.text: Nice--watch a you tube assembly video unless you want to struggle for an hour. The trigger is beyond mushy just creeps, creeps and creeps some more with finally a mushy break. I have fired literally hundreds of firearms over the past 50 yrs, and this is absolutely the worst trigger I have ever encountered. This will cost you game , wounded animals, etc. Otherwise nice for the price
customer_reviews.author: never238837

customer_reviews.title: it's not for me I want to return it
customer_reviews.text: The crossbow doesn't work properly and it's hard to cock
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Hard to cock, but powerful
customer_reviews.text: Pros: This crossbow is very accurate, can shoot 70 consistently. Very powerful. Great price for the quality. Easy to put together, just watch the video. Cons: I have arm and back injuries so I cannot pull back a compound bow, that's why I purchased a crossbow. But I cannot cock this crossbow myself. I purchased a mechanical cocking device, the only one that is supposed to fit this bow, and it gets stuck on the rails. If you have poor upper arm or back strength do not purchase this.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn S

customer_reviews.title: Picture shows different scope on product
customer_reviews.text: The bow package it’s awesome, it shoots good I like it. but!! what it shows on Amazons Internet it’s not exactly what you get, the scope shows to be lighted scope but you do not get that!! that is the only reason I gave three stars I tried three times to get the right product and didn’t get it 😡
customer_reviews.author: David E.

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat for $$
customer_reviews.text: Quality. Small groups at 50. Scope cap got cross threaded and "click click click" adjusted my sight-in at the very end!!!! SO...be very careful with this. I will have to replace the scope I think come shooting time or cut off the cap and sight in again. Overall, the scope is fine beyond that. CB is very nice. Don't buy into the 500 hype unless you plan to spend the 1500 on the big dogs. And if so, I hope you have saved for retirement, kids college, emergency fund, and have no CC debt!!!..Free advice, no need to thank me.
customer_reviews.author: Jethro Jonz

customer_reviews.title: Stock is a little noisy
customer_reviews.text: For hunting the adjustable stock is a little noisy. The crossbow is accurate with the executioner bolts I ordered. I never fired the included bolts because of the many reviews I found that said they were to light and could damage the crossbow. Trigger is ok and the optic is cheap as expected. Very good for the money and I have been able to resolve the stock noise.
customer_reviews.author: foster4mom

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: String snapped on first shot. Paid to get restrung. Took out again for another practice round. String broke again. Wont buy another product from them.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Inferior string and poor support after sale
customer_reviews.text: String broke on about the 20th bolt fired. Crossman doesn’t cover the cheap strings they use, they just sell replacement cheap strings for about $35 each time. Avoid if you actually want to shoot a crossbow, should have paid attention to the previous reviews
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an expert on crossbows but this CenterPoint Sniper 370 was pretty easy to put together. I did have to shorten the rope for cocking but that was trivial. I fired a bolt at my fence and the bolt went right through the 2x4, I mean it was so fast I couldn't see it. I do have a shooting chronograph on order and will be testing for FPS soon. But so far I very happy!
customer_reviews.author: SeeNoEvil

customer_reviews.title: LIke the crossbow But the scope and rings are poor
customer_reviews.text: I really like the crossbow. I have been a archer for many years but my shoulders been acting up. I'm new to crossbows and saw the price thought how can I go wrong. Well the wrong was in the scope and rings! The crossbow would shot low and left consistantly and no matter how many clicks I would add to the scope it wouldn't change the impact point.
customer_reviews.author: k177

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for beginners and women!
customer_reviews.text: This will be my first year Bow hunting and this is definitely the perfect bow for beginners! Also being a woman and shorter than most men, I love that it is easy to adjust! The only thing that I did not care for was all the assembly I had to do, but that was my only minor issue!
customer_reviews.author: Tony Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Excellent crossbow for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I have been shooting this crossbow since Christmas 2019 and have had great success with it. Fired probably close to 100 times with no issues and it’s every bit as accurate as day one. I can’t speak highly enough about this thing! It is on the loud side when you fire it however it’s not anything I’m going to be worrying about as the bolts fly so fast game animals won’t have time to react before they’ve been shot. I was out shooting it yesterday and wanted to have a little fun so I backed up to 50 yards and gave it a go. 2” off bullseye!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth R Kelly

customer_reviews.title: More for your money.
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this crossbow is a steal. Machined aluminum rail is found on much higher end crossbows. It’s fast. 370 feet per second! The grip and butt stock are AR-15 compatable and interchangeable. Trigger isn’t too bad, but not the greatest. It’s fairly accurate. We bought this for our niece to hunt with and I may buy one as a backup to have or to tinker with. I recommend this crossbow. Assembly is very easy and good directions.
customer_reviews.author: robert l

customer_reviews.title: O it's good, for this price it can't be beat!
customer_reviews.text: Yup its awesome! All the power you need and great value for what you get. Buy the better and heavier bolts for it. Its powerful and accurate and not really that loud. The stock has a bit of play but thats the only thing I could nitpick if I tried, absolutely does not affect anything though. Highly recommend it to anyone looking for a crossbow.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy M. Matteson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Was a rough start because im like most men don't like to read instructions but was very clear heck if I can build airplanes I can put this thing together it took about 1 hour open to shooting its hard hitting monster very nice. Just a cool toy.. Not a toy it can kill and made perfect for it.
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: This thing is fast....
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this bow last week and received yesterday. assembly was easy and fast. I had it shooting silver dollar groups at 30 yards in no time. I will say be prepared to shoot mechanical broadheads, it wouldn't shoot my Muzzy 3 blade fixed with any consistency because of the speed i'm assuming. I was able to shoot swackers very close to the field points. This thing has the feel and accuracy of xbows that cost twice as much. It's almost hard to believe that you can get this kind of accuracy and quality for so little. If you're on the fence about a crossbow, you wont go wrong with this bow.
customer_reviews.author: CHAD A.

customer_reviews.title: . REEGOX bolts are approved,  broadhead or soft point 100 grains, no more.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Description in 1 word. I also bought REEGOX, I bought 24! These bolts are nearly Indestructable bolts blow thru bales of straw at 30, 60, and 90 yards plowing right Into the ground I pull them out and reuse them 3 arrows 30 times fletch still good!Caution flex and twist eat shaft before Each shot. Do not use the center point bolts that come with the crossbow, but do save the #3 100 grain soft points. This crows bow has fired about 40 bolts and has Reliable and predictable Accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe c.

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you have a target that can handle the power of this bow
customer_reviews.text: Enjoying it so far. Was easy to assemble even for a new crossbow user like me. Seems very sturdy and well made and has plenty of customization options to get just the right fit for you. In testing it out I learned just how much power this thing had when it completely buried the first arrow into a hay bale target so make sure you have a target than can handle the power of this bow.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher H.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome 👍
customer_reviews.text: I have had this crossbow for two years now. I've killed six deer with it, hopefully one more before season is over. All I have added was limb silencer's to it. Go out and buy good bolts for it and extra luminocks, because all the deer you shoot it goes right through them and inbeds into the ground never finding it. Also buy a de - cocking arrow so you don't ruin yours. Take care of your strings and rail and it will take care of you. Hope it helps , Happy Hunting from CT.
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Deadly bow at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Great bow for the price. This is one hell of a deal. The only problem I had was just in the scope. I had to adjust it all the way up to get my carbon express pile driver arrows and 100 grain WAC Em’s to sight in. This is a powerful bow. First day out with it I took a big doe. The deer was at a slight angle when I shot. It hit right where I put it. The arrow through the deer hitting the vitals and out the other side. The deer ran about 50 yds and dropped. Very pleased with this bow.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Gieroski

customer_reviews.title: junky scope
customer_reviews.text: like the crossbow just the scope they supply is garbage wont even sight in bottoms the up and down out before it get to the top line in the scope thats the 10 to 20 yard line and it cant adjust to go down that far .what garbage like i said great crossbow garbage scope and returning just the scope for replacement is like pulling teeth from a aligator .
customer_reviews.author: MeShelle Hultenschmidt

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive Beast
customer_reviews.text: Super simple to assemble, easy to operate and after a sighting in hits dead on every shot (aside from the occasional user error). Shoots through my targets and takes apart the concrete in my downstairs range, so I definitely need to rethink where and when to break this out; unless I want to re-cement my range every few weeks.... For large game this is a solid entry bow!
customer_reviews.author: Luke Axelrod

customer_reviews.title: Missing bolt but good crossbow
customer_reviews.text: Great budget crossbow. accurate, easy to assemble. I would give it 5 stars but mine was missing a bolt/arrow. I am glad the missing item didn't keep the crossbow from functioning. I'm not going to send it back for that so I kept it as is.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Houston

customer_reviews.title: Had high hopes
customer_reviews.text: Well I have shot many crossbows and am a avid archer and for the money this bow is ok but not great like the reviews I read said. 1st It is loud 2nd the strings are rubbing and fraying within first dozen shots so cheaply made 3rd when cocking the bow the clips are getting caught on the fire/safe switch putting the bow on fire automatically and then getting stuck under the decocker lever forcing me to pull the string to release tension so I can unhook it which is not ideal nor the safest route....Could I have got a dud maybe? But to many issue to be happy with this new purchase!
customer_reviews.author: ctownballa

customer_reviews.title: outta the box and too the hunt with quickness and confidence
customer_reviews.text: There isn't anything I don't like about the product, it came as advertised . Very nice looking bow, heavy and well built....shoots straight fast and dead on at 20 yards...I would recommend the centrepoint sniper 370 for all levels of crossbow activities....great for zapping targets and I have no problem going for Grizzly Bear.... I mean Mule or Blacktail bucks with it...and it's by far and away a great value buy... the assembly is simple...jus go2 youtube.. Thank you centerpoint and thank you amazon I appreciate good products and good service..
customer_reviews.author: J2theD

customer_reviews.title: FYI, DOES NOT INCLUDE A SLING even though it is listed.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to report yet, just received it today (10-3-19) It's not a big deal, but i figured I'd let everyone know that even though the product details ( at this time) lists that it comes with a sling, it does not. Tested it in out back, and I was impressed with it, but time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Marty M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice x-bow, nice price.
customer_reviews.text: While I am not an experienced xbow enthusiast, this looks like a very nice xbow, ESPECIALLY for the price. It shoots nice. Easy to use. Easy to assemble. If I had one complaint, it would be that it had a notable "snap" (sound) when it is fired. The trigger does have a long pull, but the weight is consistent throughout the pull so it doesn't bother me a bit. If I have issues, I'll revise.
customer_reviews.author: Crawdad

customer_reviews.title: Nice crossbow!
customer_reviews.text: A little tricky putting together but a nice looking bow when it is ready to fire. Haven’t gotten passed 25 yards yet but driving nails with it off of a bench rest. I am not sure about young beginners because you have to be able to cock it which isn’t overly easy, tired after 20 shots but very fun.
customer_reviews.author: Kate V

customer_reviews.title: sniper 370 centerpoint cross bow
customer_reviews.text: Now that the weather is better and we are all stuck at home.I got my new crossbow centerpoint 370 sniper out . put it together. sight it in. Shot very accurate ,shooting a 5 spot target so as not to destroy the 3 arrows that came with the bow. Need to buy arrows. Very happy with new centerpoint bow!
customer_reviews.author: leonard j heffernan

customer_reviews.title: awesome Xbow
customer_reviews.text: This thing shoots like a 800 dollar bow. I lve everything about it. Ill eventually upgrade the scope but the provided scope still works well. Best part I can use AR butt stocks.......shoots about a 2 inch group at 50 yards out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy M.

customer_reviews.title: Super crossbow for the money
customer_reviews.text: You will not be disappointed with this crossbow. Well made, great features and plenty of power. And the price is unbeatable. I use carbon express piledriver bolts instead of the supplied bolts in the kit for hunting. The supplied bolts are ok for practice
customer_reviews.author: scotty dogg

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this crossbow for my sons and I prefer using it to my own crossbow, which is older, but more expensive. It's tough to beat the value on this one. It shoots fast and flat and the scope is surprisingly good. I'm no expert archer, but I think this is a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Winesburger

customer_reviews.title: Top of the line.
customer_reviews.text: I can’t say enough about it. This was a Christmas present for my son. It’s a true leader at that price point. I’ve harvested more large pigs then you’ll believe. The power is unsurpassed even from bows in the $1000 range.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: One shot one kill, that's the way it went down. This crossbow shoots flat a long way down range. Don't get greedy with distance , that said this year's buck was harvested at 45 yards from a tree stand. Awesome bang for the buck ! Told a friend, he ordered one and took a very nice buck first trip out. Much closer at 20 ft.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Crossbow
customer_reviews.text: I personally own a ten point crossbow, and was looking for an entry level crossbow for my 16 year old son. We received the bow and man was I surprised.. this thing is fast accurate and it comes ready to shoot.. the adjustable stock is wonderful.. the trigger pull is a little long but that should be expected at this price... with out a doubt buy this
customer_reviews.author: Kevin J Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Great Beginner Crossbow
customer_reviews.text: Got this crossbow on a black friday deal and couldn't be more pleased for the price point. Great beginner crossbow. Immediately got me hooked on archery and picked up my first compound bow a couple weeks back.
customer_reviews.author: Cody S.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely accurate. Quality product. Cannot beat value for the money! Amazed with quality and performance. Don’t be afraid of the price; it’s as good as any 1000 dollar bow! Thrilled that I was brave enough to give this a chance. Would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Good low price Xbow
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my teenaged son. It will do him well for a couple years until he saves up for a better one. Great xbow for a beginner at this pricepoint. Do yourself a favor and buy some quality bolts right away. The supplied bolts leave a lot to be desired. We use Bloodsport Hunter and Bloodsport Witness bolts at our house. If you are saving up for a mid to high end xbow but want something to get you shooting, this is a great optio.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Otto

customer_reviews.title: Will break
customer_reviews.text: After using the product for a few seasons the draw string snapped on my and could have hurt me really bad but overall its a good product just sucks I wont be able to use it for any more seasons.
customer_reviews.author: Makanaky Castillo

customer_reviews.title: Decent crossbow
customer_reviews.text: This is my first crossbow, so inexperience may be speaking, but I found it not easy to assemble (the instructions are not the easiest to follow) and hard to cock
customer_reviews.author: moog

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy this product very much. I was rather surprised by the power with my first shot. The bolt punched right through my wooden target board and through the metal plate I fixed the backside to. Of course i was firing at around 15-20 yards. Ruined the fletching on the bolt too.
customer_reviews.author: Dancing Hands Drew

customer_reviews.title: Great crossbow
customer_reviews.text: Crossbow arrived quickly. Very easy to assemble. Good weight. With slight scope adjustment I was getting 1 inch grouping at 50 yards. My friend has a crossbow that he paid twice as much for. Let him try this one out and he decided he liked everything about this one more.
customer_reviews.author: Goodnuff77

customer_reviews.title: hard to cock
customer_reviews.text: the instructions were not complete and did not mention the small piece and rubber cushion between the 2 pieces of the assembly near the front.
customer_reviews.author: rediornot

customer_reviews.title: A must have for every hunter
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic crossbow. Different versions (older vs newer) vary with contents. Older had strap, newer came with extra bolt. Very accurate.
customer_reviews.author: IrvineDad

customer_reviews.title: Great bow!
customer_reviews.text: Better get a good strong target and stiff arrows cause this thing shoots hard! Did not come with the illuminated scope but this one seems to do pretty well in the dark which is what I wanted anyway. This thing is crazy accurate! Looks beautiful. I could not be happier! Thank you CenterPoint for making a good bow at an affordable price!
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Love this bow!
customer_reviews.text: At first I was skeptical when I ordered this crossbow. After unboxing it today, fooling with the 10 minute assembly, and sighting it in, I must say I love this thing! I like the adjustable stock and lower grip. The finish on the bow was great, and the bow sighted in within 4 arrows. The grouping is consistent and the bow seems really well made. I would recommend this thing highly over many of its more expensive competitors!
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Great for target
customer_reviews.text: Really like the look and feel. Nice for practicing and just having fun. Not sure about hunting though. Very heavy towards the front so you definitely need to have a good support or brace. The scope is quite cheap. But I still enjoy using it. Still not giving up on compound bow though.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: this is my first crossbow and its awesome. shooting 1 inch groups at 20 yards standing. several bolts in the same hole at 20 years from a bench. long trigger pull takes getting used to, unlike the short pull on most rifles. seems high quality so far. optic is not pro, but its good enough. standard picatinny rails will accommodate after market accessories. feels just like a front heavy AR15 when shouldered.
customer_reviews.author: Matt J Stoner

customer_reviews.title: All in all a good crossbow
customer_reviews.text: To start off the Sniper 370 is a great crossbow, especially for beginners. It’s pretty self explanatory on how to put it together But if your not sure the Instructions make it super easy. I like how the crossbow is balanced which makes for smooth shooting, the only problem with this crossbow is how sloppy the trigger is. It has a super long pull which makes it seem like you have to pull 2” before it fires . All in all I give the crossbow four stars
customer_reviews.author: bo watson

customer_reviews.title: Great crossbow! Definite killer.
customer_reviews.text: This crossbow is a great buy. I’m impressed with the quality of the scope that came with it. It’s easy to put together out of the box and with a few adjustments to the scope was driving bolts damn near on top of each other. Taking this beauty hunting for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Super-Six-Oh

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable power. I tried to use a target I’d been using for my compound bow. This thing shot completely through it. I have to get a new target to practice. Unbelievable power
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Shrewsbury

customer_reviews.title: Great crossbow but trash scope.
customer_reviews.text: I like the crossbow. It is easy to assemble and shoots great but the scope is trash. Can't sight it in to shoot straight at all no matter how many adjustments i made it still shot far down and left.
customer_reviews.author: a.m.

customer_reviews.title: Great crossbow CRAPPY scope!
customer_reviews.text: Look I give this product a 3 only because of the scope... I have the vertical setting turned all the way up and am still having to compensate to be able to shoot a bullseye. Other than that the crossbow seems to be pretty great!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Curley

customer_reviews.title: Badass
customer_reviews.text: Assembly may be a bit tricky for some because there are people who can't tie their shoes, but you can want a lot of youtube videos that can help. Overall this thing is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: jevak

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble. If you are mechanically inclined you can figure it out from the pictures. Only complaints are the red open sticker was cut and had a second placed on top and bolts are cheap. Pretty accurate right out of the box. I waxed strings and cams before i used it and i lubed the slide and cams after i cocked it as well. Cocking was a breeze. Shoots pretty quiet as well. Hopefully i don't have any problems like the bad reviews i read.
customer_reviews.author: Travis James

customer_reviews.title: Don’t overthink it
customer_reviews.text: For $238 there is not another crossbow in the world that is as accurate easy to assemble or faster than this bow By far one of the best purchases I have ever made
customer_reviews.author: Zak

customer_reviews.title: Best Xbow for the money
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Xbow for the money! I bought and installed a trigger enhancement from a person on crossbow nation and have rifle quality trigger pull. Bolt are cheap that came with it but bought headhunter bolts from academy. Harvested my first doe this weekend with it with 100 grain rage fury broadheads. 28 yards, Entered behind right shoulder and through the left one, complete pass through and ran 10 yards. Total investment less than $300. Btw set up and trigger job instructions are on you tube.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Superb value!
customer_reviews.text: I don't see any reason to buy a different crossbow. This one is plenty fast and very accurate. I sighted it in with a few shots, and I started messing up bolts because they were hitting each other. The scope is clear and the multi plex is easy to line up. The rope cocker is easy to use. Yes the bolts that came with it weren't the greatest but you were going to have to buy some anyways. I can't wait to take this thing in the woods!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Scope is worthless
customer_reviews.text: Bow is OK but the scope is worthless. Cannot get scope to move target far enough left. Adjusted all the way to the left and arrows still 6 inches to the right. Laser arrow show same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Larry D Archer Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Building this correctly is important!
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this crossbow it's very accurate it feels really good the scope could be a little better but it's pretty good. The only thing that I would like to have changed in the future for this crossbow, is that the adjustable but of the gun is less noisy while holding and or adjusting it. But other than that the crossbow is great for the money. Hope you guys have fun because I did. Camp Atteberry in Indiana.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: i wanna give 10 star but there's  only 5
customer_reviews.text: good quality good product cause you don't need to worry about target range and i used several times after 3 year the limbs broke they send me back the limb with 5 year warranty
customer_reviews.author: timothy van nawl

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate and fast crossbow
customer_reviews.text: Got my first confirmed kill with this crossbow, while pig hunting, very fast and accurate Crossbow for the money, no need to spend 700 to 1000 dollars on other "high end crossbow" when this crossbow will compete with the best of the other High end , overpriced crossbows
customer_reviews.author: Phong D Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Overall is good, but missing part and no support.
customer_reviews.text: Overall is good, but shoulder sling is missing. It was in description, but package i received do not contain it. But it is a gift, and there is no time left to exchange it. And product support leads to useless site, where you just can't get any support.
customer_reviews.author: Edward M.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: VERY accurate and great bow for the money !! Trigger pull is long and tough , I advise to get the trigger mod online . Just google CP 370 trigger mod . or look on "Crossbow Nation" forum .
customer_reviews.author: munrus71

customer_reviews.title: Right out of the package!
customer_reviews.text: The crossbow is fast and powerful at a great price! The problem is 2 of the 3 bolts the field tip inserts came out in the target otherwise 5 stars so far.
customer_reviews.author: Pwilly600

customer_reviews.title: Amazing bow for the price
customer_reviews.text: Once the scope was sighted properly shoot a pretty tight cluster at 60 yards was a breeze. The trigger in a touch long on the draw and front is slightly heavy but all in all this is an incredible bow for the price. It has an ton of power and darn near sent the bolt clean through a 18” foam target. Really great bow
customer_reviews.author: cody e

customer_reviews.title: Great bow for the price.. All you need!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband who has a bad shoulder and he has gone back to bow hunting again! He loves this Bow!! The power and accuracy is really great for the price. He recommends this bow to anyone and would buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: Ter

customer_reviews.title: Great bow for the money.
customer_reviews.text: All of the positive reviews I read ring true. Amazing bow accurate well made easy to assemble. Couldn’t be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good deal/UPDATE!! second season issues.
customer_reviews.text: Great crossbow. Sighted in quickly and easy to use. Got a doe on Nov 1, she only went about 50 yards and folded up. The bolts that came with it aren't too good, fletching came off them after only 2 shots each. I replaced the bolts with better ones. The only downside I've come across is the sling swivels rattle when walking, stalking or just moving around. UPDATE TO ORIGINAL REVIEW: This season I took crossbow out and cocked it to check sighting and the upper right arm is de-laminating. I have contacted manufacturer and will update again after resolution.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super powerful. Arrows go deep and sometimes poke out ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I don't think this one can be beat. You'll be shooting one inch groups at probably 30 yards. And it'll probably do one inch even further I just haven't tested it too much further. Super powerful. Arrows go deep and sometimes poke out the back of my target that's made to be crossbow worthy.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!!!! We ordered a 2nd one so my boss could hunt!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my sons 10th birthday. He loves it! I got this baby zoned into a very tight grouping. Been in the mud,rain and snow so far this year! Shot several times and always works! Great product! My boss bought one as well!!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Defective scope
customer_reviews.text: It would have been nice to have received a unit that included a scope that wasn't defective. Crossman is supposed to be mailing me a replacement scope, but as it sits, its worthless . once the scope is replaced, it should be a fine crossbow.
customer_reviews.author: Twirlmaster

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and quick!!
customer_reviews.text: Great bow for the price. It’s fast, accurate and powerful. I split my bolt on my second shot from 20 yards away. That impressed me a lot. But hey a target that can handle higher speed crossbows. It blew through my bag I was using for my old Horton cross bow that shot 290fps.
customer_reviews.author: Josh L.

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Shoots straight and hits hard. Can't really complain at this price point. Scope could be better but it will do the trick. Factory settings are 20, 30, 45, and 55 yds which is kind of weird but it hits true to those points. Can't wait to tag out this season!
customer_reviews.author: AV

customer_reviews.title: Best bow on the market for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great bow, shot $800 bows and can’t tell the difference other than I have a lot of $$$ to spend on other thinks. Only complaint would be better instructions or better yet utube instruction video which is what I used to figure out two steps.
customer_reviews.author: Mm

customer_reviews.title: Best buy in archery
customer_reviews.text: Could not possibly be happier with this purchase. I usually don't buy or believe things that are too good to be true but this crossbow really is the same quality and performance of top of the line crossbows for a third of the cost. Tenpoint or Stryker could rebrand this bow and sell it 700-800 and customers would be very happy with it at that price. Compared to my styker 380 it is a little heavier and has a much longer trigger pull, however it shoots tighter groups and hits just as hard. If you are in the market for a crossbow to hunt with or just target practice and have fun, This is the bow you should buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: People complained about the instructions but they are not bad at all, common sense stuff . really like the scope it came with. Dialed it in with just a few shots. Tons of power...shot a broad head at my target after a few field tips just to see if it still hit center and it went straight through my target bag a sheet of steel and the siding on my garage . Can't wait to whack a big buck with it .
customer_reviews.author: BusyBeeMommie

customer_reviews.title: TACK.....DRIVER.....
customer_reviews.text: Why spend more money when you dont have to? This thing a seriously a tack driver. The issues that some people have had may be be incorrect assembly....? Watch the you tube video(s).....piece of cake. Enjoy!!
customer_reviews.author: Wdswmyn

customer_reviews.title: It is really a great crossbow. It comes with everything you need minus ...
customer_reviews.text: Unreal value!! This crossbow is extremely accurate and very powerful even at 50 yards plus! The only downfall is it’s weight. But I can’t knock it down a star because it’s heavy. It is really a great crossbow. It comes with everything you need minus broadheads to get out hunting.
customer_reviews.author: Kbomb

customer_reviews.title: Insane accuracy
customer_reviews.text: You will love this crossbow, no doubts, buy it, buy it, buy it. happy customer here, very powerful and accurate to whatever you shoot at.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Tack driver
customer_reviews.text: Great crossbow, after assembly it shot accurate and consistent. Super crossbow. Highly recommended for the money. A tack driver.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate and easy to put together!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought for my dad and father in law for Father's Day. They love them and use them all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Destiny Sizemore

product_meta.title: CenterPoint Sniper 370 Crossbow Package
product_meta.description: WINNER OF OUTDOOR LIFE MAGAZINE’S 2016 “GREAT BUY” AWARD! “A CNC-machined rail is a big surprise on a crossbow at this price. Our panel was impressed by how well this bow performed and we would recommend it for any hunter on a budget or anyone shopping for his or her first crossbow. The Sniper 370 is a great-shooting crossbow for an even greater price. ” (Outdoor Life, August 2016) True in 2016 and still true today, the CenterPoint Sniper 370 offers big game performance in an affordable package. Featuring a fully adjustable stock and fore grip to accommodate your shooting style and insure exceptional accuracy, quad limbs fitted with a precision CNC-machined cam and rail system delivering speeds up to 370 fps, shoot-through riser and narrow 18-inch axle-to-axle width when cocked. The Sniper 370 is easily maneuverable with a comfortable 185 pound draw weight. Rounding out the package the Sniper has integrated string suppressors to keep shots quiet and vibration-free, a 4x32-mm scope, 3 20-inch carbon arrows, quiver, rope cocker and an anti-dry fire/auto safety mechanism. The Sniper 370 is everything you need to hit the field with confidence.
feature_bullets: HIGH PERFORMANCE 370 FPS - 18-inch axle-to-axle at full draw and 185-pound draw weight
FULLY ADJUSTABLE STOCK AND FOREGRIP - For a customized fit to shoulder with confidence
QUAD LIMBS WITH PRECISION-MACHINED CAMS SYSTEM - Delivers power and accuracy
INTEGRATED STRING SUPRESSORS - For a quiet, vibration-free shot
DURABLE, LIGHTWEIGHT DESIGN - Aluminum and composite, easy to carry and maneuverable in the field
SAFETY AND ANTI-DRY FIRE TRIGGER - Ambidextrous, for right or left handed hunters
INCLUDES - A 5-year limited , three 20-inch carbon arrows, parallel quiver, 4x32 mm scope and rope cocker
